definition: Meilixue or Meri snow mountains, with peaks up to 6000 m., in Diqing Tibetan autonomous prefecture 迪慶藏族自治州|迪庆藏族自治州[Di2 qing4 Zang4 zu2 zi4 zhi4 zhou1], Yunnan
plum/plum flower/Japanese apricot (Prunus mume)
surname Mei
Li (surname)

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
snow/snowfall/CL:場|场[chang2]/to have the appearance of snow/to wipe away, off or out/to clean
surname Xue
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
surname Shan

sentences.english: Getting up at 6 a. m. to watch the sun rise over Mei Li Snow Mountain was worth it.
sentences.chinese: 早上六點就起牀去梅里雪山看日出是值得的。

sentences.english: A climb of the mountain was first attempted in 1902 by a group of British explorers and failed.
sentences.chinese: 最希望佔有梅里雪山的人就是那些登山者。

sentences.english: In Yunnan's Meili Snow Mountains, tourists are damaging both scenery and culture.
sentences.chinese: 雲南梅里雪山的風景和文化都在被破壞。

sentences.english: No man can ever possess a mountain such as Meili.
sentences.chinese: 像梅里雪山這樣的山是人類永遠不可能佔有的。

sentences.english: It is this incredible power that they hope to capture.
sentences.chinese: 梅里雪山有一種讓人渴望得到的難以置信的力量。

sentences.english: Kawa Karpo is believed to represent the mind emanation of Buddha.
sentences.chinese: 人們認爲梅里雪山代表佛智散發的光輝。

definition: Mt Yulong or Jade dragon in Lijiang 麗江|丽江, northwest Yunnan
Gonggar county, Tibetan: Gong dkar rdzong, in Lhokha prefecture 山南地區|山南地区[Shan1 nan2 di4 qu1], Tibet
Namtso or Lake Nam (officially Nam Co), mountain lake at Nakchu in central Tibet
Mt Haba (Nakhi: golden flower), in Lijiang 麗江|丽江, northwest Yunnan
Yamdrok Lake, Tibet
Mt Kawakarpo (6740 m) in Yunnan, the highest peak of Meri snow mountains 梅里雪山[Mei2 li3 xue3 shan1]
Tiger Leaping Gorge on the Jinsha River 金沙江[Jin1 sha1 jiang1] in Lijiang Naxi autonomous county 麗江納西族自治縣|丽江纳西族自治县[Li4 jiang1 Na4 xi1 zu2 Zi4 zhi4 xian4], Yunnan
Lugu Lake
Baimaxue mountains, up to 5430 m., in Dechen or Diqing Tibetan autonomous prefecture 迪慶藏族自治州|迪庆藏族自治州[Di2 qing4 Zang4 zu2 zi4 zhi4 zhou1], Yunnan
Namcha Barwa (Himalayan mountain)
abbr. for 珠穆朗瑪峰|珠穆朗玛峰, Mt Chomolungma or Qomolangma (Tibetan)/Mt Everest/Nepalese: Sagarmatha
Yamdrok Lake, Tibet
Mt Yarla Shampo, in Dawu County 道孚縣|道孚县[Dao4 fu2 xian4], Garze Tibetan autonomous prefecture, Sichuan
Daocheng county (Tibetan: 'dab pa rdzong) in Garze Tibetan autonomous prefecture 甘孜藏族自治州[Gan1 zi1 Zang4 zu2 zi4 zhi4 zhou1], Sichuan (formerly in Kham province of Tibet)
Mt Shishapangma or Xixiabangma in Tibet (8012 m)

Shangri-La (mythical location)/Shangri-La town and county in Dêqên or Diqing Tibetan autonomous prefecture 迪慶藏族自治州|迪庆藏族自治州[Di2 qing4 Zang4 zu2 zi4 zhi4 zhou1], northwest Yunnan/formerly Gyeltang or Gyalthang, Chinese 中甸[Zhong1 dian4] in Tibetan province of Kham
